the-kings-little-pathway.title: The King's little pathway
the-kings-little-pathway.description: The King's little pathway (El Caminito del Rey) is a walkway, pinned along the steep walls of a narrow gorge in El Chorro, near Álora in the province of Málaga, Spain. The name is often shortened to Camino del Rey (English: King's pathway). The walkway had fallen into disrepair and was partially closed for over a decade. After four years of extensive repairs and renovations, the walkway re-opened in 2015.

historic-walled-town-of-cuenca-1.title: Historic Walled Town of Cuenca
historic-walled-town-of-cuenca-1.description: At the heart of modern-day Cuenca, Spain, is a medieval fortified city situated high on a precipice covered with spectacular multistory dwellings.

cordoba.title: Córdoba
cordoba.description: Córdoba, also called Cordova in English, is a city in Andalusia, southern Spain, and the capital of the province of Córdoba. An Iberian and Roman city in ancient times, in the Middle Ages it became the capital of an Islamic caliphate.

santiago-de-compostela.title: Santiago de Compostela
santiago-de-compostela.description: Santiago de Compostela is the capital of the autonomous community of Galicia in northwestern Spain. The city has its origin in the shrine of Saint James the Great, now the city's cathedral, as destination of the Way of St. James, a leading Catholic pilgrimage route originated in the 9th century.

salamanca.title: Salamanca
salamanca.description: Salamanca is a city in northwestern Spain, the capital of the Province of Salamanca in the community of Castile and León. Its Old City was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1988.

toledo.title: Toledo
toledo.description: Toledo is a municipality located in central Spain, 70 km south of Madrid. It is the capital of the province of Toledo. It is also the capital of autonomous community of Castile–La Mancha.

avila-spain.title: Ávila, Spain
avila-spain.description: Ávila is a Spanish city located in the autonomous community of Castile and León, and is the capital of the Province of Ávila.

segovia.title: Segovia
segovia.description: Segovia is a city in the autonomous region of Castile and León, Spain. Its the capital of Segovia Province.

buen-retiro-park.title: Buen Retiro park
buen-retiro-park.description: The Buen Retiro Park is the one of the largest parks of the city of Madrid, Spain. The park belonged to the Spanish Monarchy until the late 19th century, when it became a public park.

alcala-de-henares.title: Alcalá de Henares
alcala-de-henares.description: Alcalá de Henares, meaning Citadel on the river Henares, is a Spanish city whose historical centre is one of UNESCO's World Heritage Sites, and one of the first bishoprics founded in Spain.

granada.title: Granada
granada.description: Granada; Arabic: غرناطة‎, DIN: Gharnaṭah is a city and the capital of the province of Granada, in the autonomous community of Andalusia, Spain.

casa-de-campo-parque.title: Casa de Campo Parque
casa-de-campo-parque.description: Sitting on 4,200 acres west of Madrid, Casa de Campo Parque was once a royal hunting estate. Today it is home to an amusement park, zoo and bustling crowds.
